COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY
Phyllis MiCHELFELDER, Director
Sally SHAIR, News Assistant
MOnument 2-8992
UN 5-4000, Exts. 2672, 2673
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
NEW YORK -- Senator Margaret Chase Smith, R., Me,, President Lynn White, Jr, of
Mills College, California, and President Lewis Webster Jones of Rutgers, The State
University of New Jersey, will analyze "Whatâ€™s Ahead For Higher Education?" at the
Tenth Annual Barnard Forum on Saturday, February 8, in the Grand Ballroom of the
Waldorf-Astoria Hotel,
The Forum is sponsored by Barnard College as a public service to the community
in cooperation with the metropolitan alumnae groups of 49 colleges and universities
and the New York City Branch of the American Association of University Women, Such
problems as expanding college enrollments, financial aid, and the demands of our
technological age for a reexamination of the curriculum will be explored. President
Millicent C, McIntosh of Barnard will preside. The Forum is open to the public.
Senator Smith will discuss the future role of the Federal government in the
realm of higher education. The senator from Maine is the only woman to serve in
both houses of Congress, She succeeded Co the seat in the House of Representatives
held by her late husband, Clyde H. Smith, in 1940, She continued to serve in the
House until 1948 when she was elected to the Senate by the greatest total vote
majority in the history of Maine, A member of the Armed Services Committee, Senator
Smith was reelected to the Senate in 1954, Prior to her marriage she was a teacher,
a business executive, and a nationally syndicated columnist. She is the holder of 27
honorary degrees and in 1949, 1950, and 1954 she was chosen Woman of the Year in
Politics by the Associated Press,
